item.title: Becks add a quote by Jenkin Lloyd Jones
item.description: "Anyone who imagines that bliss is normal is going to waste a lot of time running around shouting that he has been robbed. The fact is that most putts donâ€™t drop, most beef is tough, most children grow up to be just like people, most successful marriages require a high degree of mutual toleration, and most jobs are more often dull than otherwise. Life is just like an old time rail journey ... delays, sidetracks, smoke, dust, cinders, and jolts, interspersed only occasionally by beautiful vistas and thrilling bursts of speed. The trick is to thank the Lord for letting you have the ride." -- Jenkin Lloyd Jones

item.title: Becks add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Learn from the past, prepare for the future, live in the present." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Becks add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "There will be occasions in each of our lives when we will be called upon to explain or to defend our beliefs. When the time for performance arrives, the time for preparation is past." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Becks add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Success is the progressive realization of a worthy ideal" -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Becks add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Becks add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You can't plow a field simply by turning it over in your mind." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Becks add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Mediocrity will never do. You are capable of something better." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Becks add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "The cause of most of man's unhappiness is sacrificing what he wants most for what he wants now." -- Gordon B. Hinckley
